jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Senior Research Specialist, Expert Services Toronto , ON Description We’re looking for a Senior Research Specialist to join our team. Our Valuations & Expert Services practice is a leading market player. We are well-known in Canada and abroad for our expertise and services to corporate clients, investment funds and their legal and other advisors.
At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges.
Day to Day Responsibilities: Conduct efficient business, finance and legal research to support the professionals’ work on client engagements; Filter, organize and report research results according to professionals’ needs; Develop media-monitoring procedures around client engagements; Work proactively with all team members to understand the context of the client file and specific information needs; Provide market research and competitive intelligence to support client outreach; Offer training and consulting on research tools and resources to staff; Keep the print resource collection and online catalogue up-to-date – this includes pro-actively monitoring for new publications as well as loose-leaf filing; Liaising with Accounts Payable and Information Resources regarding research- and collection-related acquisitions and invoices; Maintain a SharePoint intranet and provide user-friendly enhancements in line with sound information architecture concepts; Provide data entry and knowledge management support in relation to client files; Miscellaneous other tasks as required by the Operations Manager.
REQUIREMENTS: You have a Master’s degree in library/information science from an accredited university; You are interested in building a career in business and finance information services; You are familiar with information architecture concepts and user-friendly intranet design; You have the ability to work in a high performing culture with time-sensitive deadlines; You have strong interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written); You are self-motivated and organized with a keen attention to detail; You are service-oriented, team-player who is eager to learn; You have proficiency with Microsoft Office. You are able to travel to the Toronto office at least 2 times a week and/or as required
About Kroll
Join the global leader in risk and financial advisory solutions—Kroll. With a nearly century-long legacy, we blend trusted expertise with cutting-edge technology to navigate and redefine industry complexities. As a part of One Team, One Kroll, you’ll contribute to a collaborative and empowering environment, propelling your career to new heights. Ready to build, protect, restore, and maximize our clients’ value? Your journey begins with Kroll.
This is a 12-month contract with potential for an extension.
In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.
Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.
https://careers.kroll.com/en/job/toronto/senior-research-specialist-expert-services/21010929 Compensation Salary begins at $70,000 and is based on qualifications and experience. Closes: 30 November, 2024 Kroll Toronto , ON Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

Manager, Programming and Outreach St. Thomas , ON Description Manager, Programming & OutreachSt. Thomas Public LibraryJob Posting Ad #STPL2410Our LibrarySt. Thomas Public Library is a fearlessly creative organization that is determined to surprise our community with new and interesting collections, programs, and services. We belong to the residents of St. Thomas and community connection is at the core of all that we do. We aim not only to be a resource to those seeking to consume information, but to be a host to those looking to create and share their own ideas and expressions. We benefit by having the support of a forward-thinking LibraryBoard and we are well positioned as a close partner within the broader strategic vision of the City of St. Thomas.Our StaffOur team makes it happen. Whether it is community events, genealogical research, 3D printing replacement parts for a dishwasher, or anything in between, we’ve got someone on hand that is up for the task! We are proud of the work that we do, and we celebrate our successes while learning and growing from our failures. Each of us brings our unique passions and interests to the table, which means that there is never a dull moment. We love us and you will too!Our Ideal Candidate● You are a highly motivated and adaptable individual who thrives in a collaborative environment.● You are a natural leader who leads by example and is passionate about fostering the growth and success of your team members.● Your genuine enthusiasm for community engagement is evident in your ability to develop and oversee engaging and impactful programs.● You are committed to providing exceptional customer service and are dedicated to creating a positive and inclusive experience for all library patrons.● Your innovative spirit drives you to explore creative and engaging ways to promote digital literacy and encourage a lifelong love of learning.Your Education and Experience● A Master of Library and Information Science degree from an ALA-accredited library school.
● Additional training in supervision and personnel management.
● A minimum of five (5) years of relevant library experience at a professional level, demonstrating progressive management responsibilities.● A valid class "G" driver's license.
This role may be the perfect fit for you if you have:● Knowledge of the regulatory and legislative environment governing public libraries.
● Experience with and an understanding of community-led planning initiatives.
● Excellent public relations and customer service skills.
● Strong vision and the ability to effectively collaborate both within the library and in the broader community.● Strategic thinking skills with experience working within a municipal environment and collaborating with a library board.● Demonstrated proficiency in staff management and supervision, encompassing areas such as developing policies and procedures, team management, and effective communication.● Exceptional leadership, organizational, communication, and management skills.
Hours of Work: 35 hour per week
Salary: Group #10 - $46.57-$56.60 (January 1, 2024)
To Apply:Interested and qualified candidates are encouraged to submit their resume and cover letter, quoting the job posting ad number STPL2410 in the subject line, to jobs@stthomaspubliclibrary.ca by 5:00 p.m. on November 7, 2024. Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Accommodations are available upon request for job applicants with disabilities.
For a comprehensive job description, please visit our website at:
https://stthomaspubliclibrary.ca/career-opportunit...
We look forward to hearing from you!
St. Thomas Public Library values the diversity of people it hires and serves. Diversity means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, respected, and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths. We are committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise us in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which you feel you need to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. Compensation $46.57-$56.60 /hour Closes: 7 November, 2024 St. Thomas Public Library St. Thomas , ON Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Library Assistant - Technical Prince Rupert , BC Description Prince Rupert Library Position
Position: Library
Assistant – Technical Permanent
Full-time,
35 hrs/week Wage:
$36.21/hr This
is a CUPE Local 105-01 Bargaining Unit Position Date of Notice: August
14,
2024
Job
Summary:
Under
the direction of the Deputy Librarian,
the
Library Assistant - Technical
provides general technical support, ILS administration, computer
system administration, website maintenance, and works on computer
related projects. The
position
also includes scheduled shifts on the circulation desk some evenings and weekends. Duties
and Responsibilities:
Maintain the library's computer networks (email, file server, etc.) and the library website. Support the technical needs of the library under direction of the Deputy Librarian.
Responsible for integration of library's print materials into digital media.
Responsible for providing computer support to staff and staff training as needed.
Assist Deputy Librarian with Sitka ILS and ILS troubleshooting.
Assist patrons on Userful internet access stations with circulation/browsing issues and when necessary, communicate with the Userful Support Team via phone and email to troubleshoot or update stations.
Assist patrons with wireless access, ebook/audio-books and online databases. Circulation Desk duties, including but not limited to in-person, telephone and email assistance to the public.
Monitor and maintain the library's social media accounts.
Assist patrons with technical support on personal devices ie. iPads, tablets, phones, and laptops
Other duties as required.Two years post secondary education or two years library experience or combination of the twoGood interpersonal and communication skills both written and oralDetail oriented
Excellent problem solving skillsSoftware
Skills:
Comfortable with both Windows and various Linux Distributions for workstations Experience or ability to learn how to work with server side programs: Apache, email servers, Islandora, Virtual Machines, pihole, Unify, etc. Experience with website content management systems, preferably Drupal Experience in web design Experience with technologies such as HTML. Experience or ability to learn Unix skills and Evergreen ILS software which includes local system administrator responsibilities. Experience with Shell scripting an asset Maintain and expand the library's digital repository systems, including the Turning the Pages newspaper archive. Familiarity with Islandora an asset.
Experience using Facebook and Instagram with Meta Business
Video editing skills considered an asset for social media platforms
Experience with Adobe Suite an asset for designing social media postings.Hardware
Skills:
Identify specific problems of malfunctioning machines and suggest plan of action
Prioritize specific solutions
Troubleshoot staff machines: Linux servers and OS, Windows OS, Brother printers, Xerox, etc.
The Prince Rupert Library is
located on the beautiful northwest coast of British Columbia within
the Great Bear Rainforest. We strive to improve life for all
residents of our community through access to information and good
customer service. We
are committed to the process of reconciliation and recognize that we
operate on the traditional and unceded territory of the Ts'msyen
people. We strongly encourage individuals of indigenous descent to
apply for this position. Submit cover letter and
resume or CV to: Deputy Librariandeplib@citywest.ca Fax:
250-627-7743
Closing
Date: Position will remain advertised
until filled. Compensation $36.21/hr Closes: 12 November, 2024 Prince Rupert Public Library Prince Rupert , BC Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
